key_channel_insights.line_content: Over 91% of itineraries on OTAs matched AA’s website fares, but unavailable OTA offers rose by 1.2 pp, indicating emerging distribution gaps.
MSE fares aligned with AA’s website on 98.93% of itineraries last week, with minimal markups (0.50%) and rare discounts (0.22%).
56.21% of routes were priced higher on GDS—lifting fares by 0.26% on average—while parity fell to 43.40%, highlighting a channel premium.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_title: High OTA Parity with Minor Dip
ota_highlights.line_content: Over 91% of OTA itineraries matched AA’s website fares last week, down 1.1 pp week-over-week and flat month-over-month.
4.3% of OTA itineraries priced above the site (+0.15% avg) and 2.0% priced below (–0.10% avg), both showing minimal weekly change.
2.7% of origin–destination pairs were unavailable on OTAs last week, up 1.2 pp from the prior week.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Missing OTA offers climbed to 2.71% of ODs—a 1.21 pp week-over-week rise and 0.20 pp above last month.
Matched fares represented 91.04% of ODs, down 1.10 pp week-over-week and essentially unchanged month-over-month (–0.07 pp).
OTA fares above the site held at 4.27% of ODs (+0.03 pp w-o-w, +0.06 pp m-o-m) with a +0.15% average uplift.
Lower OTA fares fell to 1.98% of ODs (–0.14 pp w-o-w, –0.18 pp m-o-m) at an average discount of –0.10%.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul parity dipped to 90.27% (–1.11 pp w-o-w), with 4.79% at a +0.14% premium and 2.06% at a –0.10% discount.
Long-haul parity remained at 94.49% (–1.05 pp w-o-w), with 1.91% at a +0.20% premium and 1.62% at a –0.09% discount.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: US-origin itineraries matched 95.42% of site fares (–1.12 pp w-o-w), with 0.26% at a +0.44% premium and 2.18% at a –0.10% discount.
Non-US itineraries matched 53.48% of fares, while 38.63% carried a +0.13% premium and only 0.25% were discounted.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Bookings within 0–14 days matched 89.50% of fares (–1.57 pp w-o-w), with 4.24% at +0.14% premium and 3.35% missing offers.
Bookings >14 days out held 94.16% parity (–0.15 pp w-o-w), with 4.34% at a +0.17% premium and negligible discounts.

mse_highlights.line_content: Last week, 98.93% of MSE fares matched AA’s website, underscoring strong cross-channel consistency.
Only 0.50% of itineraries on MSE were pricier (avg +0.23%), up 0.10 pp from the prior week.
Discounted itineraries on MSE remained at 0.22% with an average discount of –0.24%, reflecting stable patterns.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: MSE N/A status affected 0.35% of routes last week, up 0.04 pp w-o-w but down 60% month-over-month.
Website and MSE prices aligned on 98.93% of routes, down 0.19 pp w-o-w but up 0.60 pp m-o-m.
Higher MSE fares represented 0.50% of itineraries, up 0.10 pp w-o-w at an average +0.23% uplift.
Lower MSE fares comprised 0.22% of itineraries, up 0.04 pp w-o-w at an average –0.24% discount.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul routes saw 98.84% parity, with 0.56% at +0.22% markup and 0.22% at –0.24% discount, all stable w-o-w.
Long-haul parity stood at 99.32%, with 0.18% at +0.43% markup and 0.22% at –0.23% discount, mirroring the prior week.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: US-origin fares on MSE matched 99.38% of site prices, with 0.19% at +0.64% and 0.23% at –0.25%, both steady.
Non-US origins saw 95.09% parity, 3.17% at a +0.02% uplift and 0.12% at a –0.12% discount.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Within 0–14 days, 98.99% of fares aligned, with 0.52% at +0.17% and 0.29% at –0.24%, consistent w-o-w.
Bookings >14 days out saw 98.80% parity, 0.45% at +0.37% and 0.08% at –0.20%, holding flat w-o-w.

gds_highlights.line_content: 56.21% of AA routes were priced higher on GDS last week, up 0.69 pp w-o-w and 1.05 pp m-o-m, averaging +0.26%.
Identical GDS and website fares dropped to 43.40%, down 0.74 pp w-o-w and 0.58 pp m-o-m.
Bookings >14 days in advance saw 70% priced higher on GDS—20 pp above close-in—at a 0.32% average premium.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Only 0.27% of routes lacked a GDS offer, decreasing by 0.05 pp w-o-w and 0.54 pp m-o-m.
43.40% of routes matched site fares, down 0.74 pp w-o-w and 0.58 pp m-o-m with zero avg variance.
56.21% of routes were pricier on GDS, up 0.69 pp w-o-w and 1.05 pp m-o-m, at a 0.26% average uplift.
Only 0.12% of routes were cheaper on GDS, rising slightly 0.09 pp w-o-w and 0.07 pp m-o-m at a 0.13% average discount.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: 56.55% of short-haul routes were priced higher on GDS, up 0.70 pp w-o-w with an average +0.26% uplift.
54.64% of long-haul fares were higher on GDS, up 0.64 pp w-o-w and 2.07 pp m-o-m at a +0.25% average.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 54.82% of US-origin routes carried higher GDS fares, up 0.57 pp w-o-w with a +0.28% average premium.
Non-US-origin routes saw 68.07% priced higher on GDS, up 1.76 pp w-o-w and 2.70 pp m-o-m, averaging +0.14%.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings were nearly split on GDS, with 49.43% higher (+0.22% avg, +1.01 pp w-o-w) against 50.11% parity.
Far-out bookings saw 69.99% higher GDS fares, flat w-o-w, at the highest average premium of 0.32%.
